sense.name: be unbearably loud
sense.examples: The deafening concussion blinded the Japanese. The silence was deafening.

sense.name: cause to become deaf
sense.examples: New wave music will deafen you. Just three girls can deafen you with their shrieking. Jesse Malin's keening yowls will deafen family pets. Bennoc wanted to actual deafen her. It would deafen us if we heard it, blind us if we saw it.

sense.name: dampen noise, make soundproof
sense.examples: So they talked loudly, that they might deafen their conscience. The money helped deafen Congress to their pleas for help. But you it was who taught me to deafen my ears to the wild thing. So you don't deafen yourself?
